Comments: The risk of new competitors entering the market is very small, mainly due to the large number of barriers to entry into the sector. Entry into the industry is associated with high capital intensity compared to uncertain and not entirely satisfactory profits. In particular, new competitors are discouraged from entering the market by very high initial investments in machinery, equipment and modern technologies, high prices and a shortage of land or a shortage of manpower.
